intro: Syngonanthus bisumbellatus var. froesii, commonly known as the Froesii goldenroot, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in compound umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties make it a subject of interest in horticulture and botanical research.
